decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Existing and Proposed Plans dated Feb 2025Location Plan dated 04.02.2025Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning

The use of the property as a House in Multiple Occupation hereby approved shall be occupied by a maximum of 5 people at any one time acting as a single household and shall not be subdivided or occupied as self-contained units. Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to safeguard the residential character of the surrounding area.

No independent cooking or laundry facilities shall be installed in any of the respective bedrooms and the communal kitchen / dining room and communal bathroom shall be retained in perpetuity.Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to ensure a satisfactory form of accommodation for future occupiers.

Prior to occupation, cycle parking should be provided in compliance with the following criteria:  Provision of 5 long stay cycle parking spaces:o in an accessible location: the access route to the store should be a minimum of 1.2m wide to enable the bike to enter the store, should be step free and involve no more than 2 doors or gate (excluding the store door). o secured: with a British Standard mortice lock or access fob o fully enclosed: 4 walls and a roof Provision of 2 short stay cycle parking spaces o Ability to lock a bicycle to a permanent fixture (e.g. Sheffield stand or wall anchor) Reason: The Council's Climate Action and Transport Policies seek to increase the use of active and sustainable transport modes. This means that access to bicycle parking should be easy and secure to remove potential barriers to cycling.

Prior to occupation, details of the design of refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste to satisfy the future number of occupiers on site, shall be provided within the development, in accordance with the London Borough of Enfield - Waste and Recycling Planning Storage Guidance ENV 08/162. In particular, waste collection vehicles must be able to get within 25m of the refuse storage point. Residents should not have to carry waste further than 30m.Reason: In order to facilitate efficient, safe and clean removal of household refuse, the location and accessibility of refuse storage plus to maintain safety on the Highway.
description: Change of use from a Class C3 (dwelling house) to a Class C4 (HMO - house in multiple occupation).

phasing_details.phase_detail: Stud wall to divide Living room into 2 rooms. Shower to be added to exisiting downstairs cloakroom. Entire Development.
